Dear Sheffield City Council,
I would like to understand the organisational structure & staffing budgets for the marketing Sheffield & city futures department within Sheffield City Council.
Please can you provide an organisational chart showing the entire management structure of the marketing Sheffield & city futures department? I am interested to know how many employees are within these departments & what the management structure looks like.
Can you also let me know what the total staff budget is for  the marketing Sheffield & city futures department?
Finally can you let me know how much the Welcome to Sheffield website cost to originally commission, when the current site was commissioned & how much the website costs to maintain on an annual basis?
Yours faithfully,
Harper

Dear Harper,
Thank you for your request for information relating to Marketing Sheffield
& City Futures which we received on 24/09/2023.
Unfortunately, Sheffield City Council cannot process your requests because
you have not given us your full name.  Section 8 of the Freedom of
Information Act states that you must give us your full name for a request
to be valid.
Could you please let us know your full name to enable us to process your
request.
For further guidance please see the Information Commissioners Office
Guidance “Recognising a request made under the Freedom of Information Act”
– in particular the section entitled “Name of the applicant”, on the link
below:

https://ico.org.uk/media/for-organisatio...
In the meantime, please do not hesitate to contact us at the email address
below if you have any queries.

Dear Harper Lee,
Thank you for your request for information relating to Marketing Sheffield
& City Futures which we received on 24/09/2023 and you validated on
26/09/2023.
Please find Sheffield City Council’s response to your request set out
below:
Management Structure of City Futures Directorate
The City Futures Directorate continually assesses its structure to ensure
it can delivery SCC priorities across the economy, investment and
regeneration. The portfolio is responsible for delivery of a wide range of
statutory and non-statutory services including:
Statutory services:
• Planning & Building Standards
• Highways Agency
• Flood Mitigation and Management
Non-statutory services:
• Opportunity Sheffield and wider employment support
• Marketing Sheffield
• Invest Sheffield
• Business Sheffield
• Climate change and sustainability team
• Transport planning and project teams
• Planning advisory services inc. infrastructure planning
• Regeneration delivery services.
• Housing growth delivery services inc. Local Housing Company
partnership.
• Capital Delivery Service (e.g. management of Heart of the City,
Levelling Up Funds)
• Property and Asset Management Services.
The below diagram is accurate as of October 2023.
[1]A diagram of a company Description automatically generated
Headcount and Paybill for all of City Futures
• The FTE headcount for City Futures Directorate is 323.66, with a
staffing budget of £18,744,000 per annum.
Headcount and Paybill for Marketing Sheffield
• As of September 2023, there were 7 permanent FTE and 1 temporary FTE
within the marketing Sheffield team. There is 1 FTE post currently
vacant. The current paybill is £271,146 per annum.
Welcome to Sheffield Website
The existing version of the Welcome to Sheffield website was commissioned
in Oct 2020.
Cost: £96,000
Annual maintenance fee: £20,375
If you have any queries about this response, please do not hesitate to
contact us.
The information provided in this response is available for re-use under
the terms of the Open Government Licence v3.0. The terms of the OGL can be
found [2]here. When re-using the information, Sheffield City Council
requires you to include the following attribution statement: “Contains
public sector information obtained from Sheffield City Council and
licensed under the Open Government Licence v3.0.”
If you are unhappy with the response you have received in relation to your
request, you are entitled to have this reviewed. You can ask for an
internal review by replying to this email. Internal review requests should
be submitted within 40 working days from the date of this response.
If you remain dissatisfied with the outcome of your internal review, you
can contact the Information Commissioner’s Office. Please see

https://ico.org.uk/make-a-complaint/offi...
for further details.
Kind Regards,

Sheffield, S1 1UJ
